elements.text: PART ONE
PRE-TITLE:
1: EXT. BEACH ON MINOS, BY TAVERNA (1945
FROM PERSUASION, SCENE 73:
[..] Come on. (FX: OPENING TARDIS DOOR)
Wait! — Where are we going?
(FROM INSIDE TARDIS) Quick, before the trail goes cold!
We’re going after answers, Will. We’re going after Schalk!
FX: THEY ENTER SHIP. DOOR SLAMS. BEAT. TARDIS DEMATERIALISES.
BEAT.
FX: ROLLING SEA, OFF. THEN TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS.
(EXITING) And here we are again.
(FOLLOWING) Outside the taverna on Minos!
Precisely, Mr Arrowsmith. As close to our moment of departure as I dare.
(FX: CLOSING DOOR BEHIND) He made a break from the woods, though. Hinterberger.
You mean Schalk, don’t you, Dr Klein? The real Schalk.
(CAUGHT OUT, IRRITATED) Of course I mean Schalk.
It is rather confusing.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 3
The point is, the woods are a good kilometre inland. Schalk wouldn’t have followed me back to the beach, not after he saw the Khlecht take Sch[alk] — (CORRECTS SELF) — Hinterberger.
(AGREEING) No, he wouldn’t.
So, Schalk’s got a head start on us. But this is an island. He’1ll have to find a boat or a plane if he wants to escape.
Or a spaceship.
What spaceship?
The vessel sent by Garundel’s employers.
Eh?

While you, me, Dr Klein and the worst warmongers in the galaxy were otherwise engaged — distracted by Garundel’s auction of the man who turned out, in fact, to be Lukas Hinterberger — Garundel’s employers were free to snatch Schalk.
So there are more aliens coming?
Oh no, Dr Klein. I think they’ve already been.
What? Really?
I think they snatched Schalk from the woods, which is why I couldn’t land the TARDIS there.
Why?
For fear that you would run into you, obviously. This is a tangled enough affair as it is, don’t you think?
But who were they? These other aliens?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 4
That’s where you come in, Mr Arrowsmith. You can help me carry out a little test.
Can I? Really?
Try not to look so revoltingly keen. You’re like a puppy panting for a chocolate drop.
What do you want me to do? Doctor?
First, take my umbrella —
(TAKING IT) Umbrella, right —
You’11 need to open it, though.
Oh, right. (FX: OPENS UMBRELLA) To, er, shade you from the sun?
Seeing as I’m redundant, I’m going for a drink. (WALKS TO TAVERNA)
Dr Klein, don’t [go]

Hold it still, please. Now — I had the foresight to bring with me a small pot of iron filings. (UNDOING LID OF POT, SPRINKLING CONTENTS IN THE AIR — ‘TWINKLING’ MUSIC?) Which, when sprinkled in the shadow cast by the umbrella, should react to the presence of particulates discharged into the local atmosphere by an interstellar drive.
They’re twinkling! They’re glowing green!
. indicating artron propulsion. Crude time technology. That narrows the field, rather.
So we follow the artron trail, in the TARDIS?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 5
Don’t be absurd. A good gust of wind — (BLOWS INTO AIR) — and it’s gone.
So we're no nearer finding Schalk?
Not unless his kidnappers left us some other clue to their identity.
What, like footprints?
(SNORTS) Footprints! Oh, Mr Arrowsmith — you do have a lot to learn.
(FX: LOWERS UMBRELLA) Sorry. I only thought — well, seeing as there’s that funny trail running from the sea to the taverna...
Trail?
All along the sand, see, like a hovercraft pattern, only not as wide? Like something say a metre wide came hovering across the beach, and... (REALISATION DAWNING) .. went into the [taverna]
. went into the taverna. Klein!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 6
2: INT. TAVERNA
FX: FROM OUTSIDE, WE HEAR WILL AND THE DOCTOR RUNNING UP ONTO
WOODEN BOARDS OUTSIDE TAVERNA.
(RUNNING UP) Dr Klein! Dr Klein!
(RUNNING UP) Elizabeth! It isn’t safe!
FX: WHAM! WILL BARGES OPEN DOOR AND RUSHES IN, FOLLOWED BY THE
DOCTOR.
Dr Klein! — Sorry, we had to warn you. We think that something came in here.
(AT BAR) Something that hovers? Something about a metre wide?
Ah, then you observed the trail, too!
I didn’t have to. It was already here.
(FX: HOVERING FORWARD FROM OFF) Do not move! Do not move! You
are my prisoners!
Doctor. Is that — is that what I think it is?
Yes.
Wow. I mean — wow!
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 7
3: INT. TAVERNA [CONTINUED]
(STEPPING FORWARD) Dalek — no, I will not move. Yes, I am your prisoner.
I’ve seen the old films — you know, from Shoreditch, and from Auderly House. But this, this is real.
Silence, or you will be exterminated!!!
Silence, yes, sorry. (SOTTO) Wow!
What are you doing here, Dalek?
What do you want with Kurt Schalk?
Dalek prisoners will not interrogate Daleks!
The very idea.
(TO KLEIN) Human female — what do you know of Kurt Schalk?
Not as much as he does. (SIPS DRINK) The Doctor.
(SWIVELLING) Doc-tor?!
(TAKEN ABACK) Elizabeth-?!

(MOCK-SLURRED) The Doctor? (FX: GETTING UP OFF BARSTOOL, SAUNTERING OVER TO DALEK THROUGH: ) Check your records, Dalek. That’s him, right there, in the hat. Look, there’s his bolice pox outside. [SIC]
It is! It is the Doctor!!!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 8
I told you so, you stupid machine — (THEN FAKE-STAGGERS, SPLASHING DALEK WITH DRINK) Oops, sorry. Didn’t mean to splash your stick-gun. Gun-stick. Thing.
You are inebriated!
Rubbish, I’ve only had the one. (SIPPING DRINK) Mr Arrowsmith! Remind me — what’re the Dalek standing orders, should they encounter the Doctor in the field?
Dr Klein, what are you doing?
(ANSWERING KLEIN) Exterminate him!!!
Externimate him, exactly! Hadn’t you better get on with it?
Stand aside!
Golly, yes. Wouldn’t want to get in the way of your shot.
Elizabeth, this is a dangerous game you’re playing.
Oh, I’m sure Mr Dalek here will be happy to let me and Will go, once you’ve been ext- shot. Isn’t that right, Mr Dalek?
Silence!!! Doctor. You are an enemy of the Dalek race. You must be exterminated.
(SHOVING DOCTOR ASIDE) No!
(SWIVELLING TO FOLLOW) Exterminate!!!
FX: DALEK GUN-STICK FIRES — LIGHTING THE ALCOHOL KLEIN
SPLASHED OVER IT. WHOMPF! IT GOES UP IN FLAMES. WILD SHOT SIZZLES PAST DOCTOR AND WILL, HITTING THE WALL.
(SCREECHES) Eiiiiiiiii! Alert! Alert! I am burning!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page
Well, if you will start shooting once I’ve splashed you in OuZO...
Flaming Sambuca!
Language, Mr Arrowsmith.
FX: DALEK BEGINS FIRING RANDOMLY. BOTTLES EXPLODE, FANNING
FLAMES.
(SWIVELLING FRANTICALLY) My casing is alight!!! I am
burning!!!
Now the bar’s alight. Let’s get out of here, shall we?
Second that!
Quickly!!!
FX: AS THEY PILE OUT OF THE TAVERNA:
You may not leave! You will all be exterminated! Exterminate!!!
FX: FIRES AGAIN. MORE BOTTLES EXPLODE.
Burning! Burning! I am burn[ing]
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 10
4: EXT. BEACH ON MINOS, BY TAVERNA
FX: KLEIN, WILL AND DOCTOR RUNNING ONTO SAND.
(DIVING TO GROUND) Down, both of you-!
FX: AS WILL AND DOCTOR DIVE — THE TAVERNA EXPLODES. HUGE
FIREBALL.
BEAT.
(RAISING HEAD) Cheers, Dalek. Mud in your eyestalk.
Standard procedure, of course, to leave a rear guard behind.
What, to make sure no-one could pick up their trail?
Precisely. Oh, but this is disastrous!
‘Thank you’? Would be nice?
That was a very well-executed plan, Dr Klein. Brilliant, in fact.
It was, wasn’t it?
Self-congratulation can wait! If the Daleks have Schalk, they’re halfway to building a Persuasion Machine of their own. And if you thought the world being made to think Nazi was bad enough...
So where’s Schalk now?
Where will they have taken him?
Right now.. I haven’t the faintest idea.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 11
4: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM [ONE YEAR AGO]
FX: REVERSE ECHO, TO SUGGEST FLASHBACK? THEN INTO: DALEK
HEARTBEAT.
(STRAPPED DOWN, STRAINING AGAINST RESTRAINTS) Please, I have told you! One thousand times I have told you...!
Your name. Tell us your name.
Hinterberger! My name is Lukas Hinterberger!
No. Your name is Kurt Schalk. Confirm your identity, or you
will suffer more pain.
How can I tell you I am someone I am not?!
(SWIVELLING EYESTALK) Electrify him again.
I obey.
Please, I have tried to co-opera[te]
FX: THROBBING BURST OF ELECTRICITY.
SCREAMS
FX: SIMULTANEOUSLY, DOORS SLIDE UPON, OFF.
(RUSHING IN) Oh no, no, no! Cease this crude coercion!
FX: ELECTRICITY CUTS OFF.
SOBS
Falkus. Interrogation of prisoner Schalk is not your concern.
No, Black Dalek, but his mind is! Such blunt techniques might cause irretrievable damage to the prisoner’s sanity!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 12
Thank you, young Herr. Thank you. How long has it been since I last saw a kindly face? Or anything like a face at all?

(TO BLACK DALEK) The prisoner is not pretending. His consciousness has retreated inside the ‘Hinterberger’ identity. Perhaps this was not just caused by the Persuasion Machine. Perhaps, even, this is the influence of the Persuasion Machine, seeking to protect its secrets.
(TO BLACK DALEK) You see? There is nothing to be done, Schwarze Dalek. Release me or kill me, either would be a blessing.
I did not say that nothing could be done...
W-what?
Falkus? What do you propose?
Surgery, of course. If the part of the prisoner’s brain that insists he is Hinterberger will not willingly recede — why, we'll have to cut it out.
No! Please! This is monstrous!
I have already had a team of Daleks fitted with the appropriate... tools. With your permission, Black Dalek?
Agreed!
No! No!
(CALLING OFF) Enter!
FX: 3 x DALEKS GLIDE IN, WHIRRING SAWS ON THEIR SUCKER ARMS...
Do not be afraid, Herr Schalk. You will soon be your... old self again.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 13
Nooooo-!!!
FX: FADE OUT ON WHIRRING SAWS.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 14
6: EXT. PLANET OF MISTS
FX: FADE UP EERIE, SWIRLING, ‘WHISPERY’ AMBIENCE. DOCTOR WALKS
TO A HALT — SLIGHT CRUNCHINESS TO SURFACE, HE’S WALKING ON GROUND BONES.
(CALLING ALL AROUND) Wraiths of Lemuria! I desire an audience!
BEAT — NO ANSWER
(TRIES AGAIN) Please, spare me the slow entrance, I don’t need to be spooked. (MORE TO SELF) Besides, I don’t have the time.
FX: WHISPERS REVERSE-ECHO ‘COALESCE’ INTO TWO EERIE,
SSSLIGHTLY SSSIBILANT VOICES.
WRAITH #1: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) Time Lord. Doctor.
WRAITH #2: (DITTO) What is it you want here, Time Lord Doctor?
I wish to consult your database. Your Book of All Ills.
WRAITH #1: Do you know what that costs?
WRAITH #2: Do you know how we need to be paid?
I’m standing in a desert of ground bones. I have some idea.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 15
7: INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: STATIONARY TARDIS.
(SITTING, READING — SNORTS LOUDLY) You should read this piece about tachyons, Dr Klein. It’s really very funny.
FX: TURNS PAGE OF BOOK.
(BY CONSOLE) How long has he been now?

Twenty-six — no, twenty-seven minutes exactly. You should have read something, like he said. Look, he’s got all of next year’s volume of New Scientist in his library. It’s like the dentist’s waiting room you’d never want to leave.
I’ve had enough of this. I’m going out after him.
FX: ACTIVATES DOOR CONTROL. SWIRLING MISTS OUTSIDE.
Half-an-hour, he said he’d be. And we weren’t to leave the TARDIS without him, in case we got lost in the mist.
(WALKING OUT) I will not be kept in detention, like a schoolgirl caught with an errant hemline!
(CALLING AFTER) Take your shoes off at least, it seemed to be important! (FX: TURNS PAGE AGAIN) (TO SELF, MILDLY) Oh, she'll be in so much trouble with the head...
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 16
8: EXT. PLANET OF MISTS
FX: AS BEFORE.
WRAITH #2: The planet Azimuth, Time Lord Doctor.
WRAITH #1: There is the one you seek.
(SURPRISED) Azimuth?! — That's... unexpected.
FX: PAGES OF HUGE BOOK SLAMMED TOGETHER.
WRAITH #2: You are now in our debt, Time Lord Doctor.
WRAITH #1: Do not forget: the fee must soon be paid.
And I thank you, Lemurians, for your terms of credit. Now — if you’ll excuse me, I have an appointment to keep with a certain Mr — [Schalk].
(OFF, BUT APPROACHING) Doctor? Is that you? Doctor!
WRAITH #2: Who is this who approaches?
Just an associate of mine. Elizabeth — I told you to stay in the TARDIS.
WRAITH #1: Elizabeth...
What are these creatures? They seem.. insubstantial.
Substantially so, yes.
What are you doing, meeting with ghosts?
TO WRAITHS) Our business here is concluded. (HISSED TO KLEIN
Back to the TARDIS, now!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 17
FX: AS THE DOCTOR AND KLEIN RUSH AWAY...
WRAITH #1: (CALLING AFTER) Remember, Time Lord Doctor, there will be a reckoning...!
BEAT
WRAITH #2: This ‘Elizabeth’
WRAITH #1: Yes. She reeked of familial corruption.
WRAITH #2: Brother... would the Time Lord Doctor cheat us...?!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 18
9: INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOORS OPEN. DOCTOR BOWLS IN, FOLLOWED BY KLEIN.
(STANDING TO ATTENTION) You’re back! Both of you!
Indeed.
(BOUNDING TO CONSOLE) And don’t think I’ve not noticed you've been reading next year’s New Scientists, Mr Arrowsmith.
(CHASTENED) Was that wrong?
It’s cheating.
FX: CLOSES DOORS. BUTTON-PRESSING, SWITCH-FLICKING THROUGH:
Doctor — who were those creatures? What were you up to out there?
Cheating, of course. Now: Archetryx, Aridius, Atrios... Azimuth!
FX: DEMATERIALISATION BEGINS.
What’s on Azimuth?
Kurt Schalk, I presume.
Specifically — a man whose DNA profile matches Kurt Schalk’s exactly.
And you got that information from ghosts?
Not ghosts, Wraiths. The Wraiths of Lemuria. Think of them as spectral vigilantes.
Whenever you two speak, I get the feeling I need footnotes.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 19
The Wraiths of Lemuria. Surviving remnants of a species so obsessed with criminal wrongdoing that they decided to build the largest database of lawbreakers’ DNA in the universe.
Well, obviously.
Unfortunately, it took them so long to put their gazillion- name database together, that by the time their Book of All Ills was complete...
Let me guess: everyone in it was centuries dead.

Precisely. Rather than acknowledge that they’d wasted their entire existence compiling something inherently useless, the Lemurians decided instead to prosecute the living descendants of those named in their Book.
That hardly seems fair!
More to the point, since the number of descendants multiplies down the generations, it made virtually everyone guilty of a capital crime.
Hence the deserts of bone dust on their planet.
What remains of the Lemurians’ essence is little more than a psychic rage, the echo of the howl of the lynch mob.
But if these Wraiths are so insubstantial, surely they can’t do anyone harm?
They could haunt you, Mr Arrowsmith.
(HOW ABSURD!) Haunt you!
Dig into your psyche, whispering your guilt, waking or sleeping... and haunt you to death.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 20
Doctor, were your ancestors innocent?
No-one is innocent. (ROUNDING ON KLEIN) Which is why, Elizabeth, I told you to remain in the TARDIS!
I.. forgive me, Doctor. I needed to know.
(BLITHELY) They’1ll put that on your gravestone, Dr Klein.
(SHARPLY) You said that out loud, Mr Arrowsmith.
(SHEEPISH) Gosh, I did, didn’t I?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 21
10: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM [NINE MONTHS AGO]
FX: REVERSE ECHO, TO SUGGEST FLASHBACK? THEN INTO: DALEK
HEARTBEAT.
Speak!
Schalk. My name is Kurt Schalk. Of that I am certain.
You see, Black Dalek? Three months have passed, but as you see — progress.
The human named Schalk — you will surrender the schematics for the Persuasion device. (BEAT) Now!!!
My name is Kurt Schalk. Hauptsturmftihrer Schalk of the Schutzstaffel — party number one-eight-five, zero-six-nine! And I submit these materials to a superior officer only!
Surrender the schematics, or you will be exterminated!
DALEKS x 3: (A GREEK CHORUS, TO ONE SIDE) Exterminated!!!
Then put me on the train to your Vernichtungslager, your death camp! I give you nothing, Schwarze Dalek!
Falkus. Explain!!!
You heard the Hauptsturmfiihrer. It seems there is no inducement the Daleks can offer, to make him accede.
Ach, I could have betrayed the Reich for an American honey, an English rose, even a big-hipped Russian doll... but break faith with my Flhrer for you croak-voiced Cyclopses? I would sooner die!
Then the Daleks will cut the blueprints from your brain!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 22
Inadvisable, Black Dalek. Data corruption would be... inevitable.
(TRIUMPHANT) Ha!
There is no alternative!
Oh, but I do have another strategy in mind. One with a far greater probability of success.
Then proceed!!!
DALEKS x 3: Proceed! Proceed! Proceed!!!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 23
11: EXT. MONUMENT PLAZA
FX: GENTLE HUM OF HOVERCARS ZIPPING BETWEEN BUILDINGS. WE’RE
IN A WIDE, URBAN, WELL-ORDERED BUT STRANGELY QUIET ENVIRONMENT. TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS.
This is it? This is Azimuth?
(SURPRISED) Oh! It’s very, um...
(FX: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) Very what, Mr Arrowsmith?
. empty, I suppose. Like Canary Wharf on a Sunday.
(FX: WALKING OFF A FEW STEPS) There’s a map over here. A grid of the city, I think. Only it doesn’t say where we are.
You are in Monument Plaza.
(STARTLED) Oh! — (BEAT) Monument? I don’t see a monument.
Behind you.
It’s a statue. Well, statuette. (FX: WALKS OVER, OTHERS FOLLOW) A naked girl with — is that a baseball bat?
Yes.
She seems — I don’t know, familiar.
(TEASING) Does she, Will?
(BLUSHING) I don’t mean her body. Her face. I’ve seen it somewhere before. (BEAT) There’s an inscription at the bot[trom] — base, I mean.
Was that her name? ‘Liberty’?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 24
A liberty is what she’d have called it.
Eh?
She wasn’t naked, at the time of the Liberation. All those years ago...
(REALISATION) Of course! That’s who she is!
(BAFFLED) Who-?
The films, from Shoreditch, taken by the Counter-Measures mob — that’s where you’ve seen her before!
(RECOGNITION) Oh, yes-!
Doctor, she was your companion!
Ace was her name. Twenty years ago this plaza was a burial pit, and this perfumed air smelled only of putrefaction.
You’ve been here before.
It was Azimuth’s misfortune to be positioned as a perfect staging point between two solar systems — the one the invaders came from, and the one they were invading.
I see.
The aliens enslaved the colonists, used them to service their fleet. But with blood and ingenuity and the strategic application of a baseball bat, they were eventually defeated.
This would have been another of your... interventions, I take Tt?
Yes. (BITTERLY) How soon they forget.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 25
Well, at least they built a statue. (WORRIED) Do people often build naked statues of your companions?
(SARCASTIC) Oh yes. I’m sure it happens all the time.
(REALLY WORRIED NOW) What, really?

Look at this plaza. Perfectly paved, not so much as a weed between the flagstones. The windows of the skyscrapers above, glittering in the sun. (FX: CLATTERS SWINGING METAL LID OF NEARBY BIN) Electronic dustbins — all empty. But the bronze of this statue has turned colour, turned to verdigris.
Is that chewing gum, on the end of her bat?
Most likely. The only object as far as the eye can see that’s in anything other than pristine condition... is Ace’s statue. Oh yes, they forget alright.
Are you sure you’re not, well, over-reacting?
(ALOUD, CALLING OUT) Citizens of Azimuth! Don’t you remember? Don’t you care? Don’t you recall... the Daleks?!?
FX: THE WORD ECHOES ALL AROUND THE PLAZA. BEAT. SUDDENLY:
(HARSHER NOW) Stay where you are!
Was that the map?
(SIMILAR TO MAP, BUT MALE) Unknown citizens, stay where you are!
And that was the bin.
FX: SAME AS MAP VOICE, BUT ECHOING FROM BUILDINGS ALL AROUND
The police have been called. Stay where you are!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 26
(ALARMED) Police-?
(CALLING INTO AIR) What, just because I said ‘Daleks’?
I assume getting arrested was part of your plan?
No, in fact. Getting to grid reference 4AA was the plan.
Grid number 4AA. Correctional Facility.
A prison! So you did want to get arrested?
No, I wanted to visit. Actually being incarcerated would be most unhelpful.
Police response time currently standing at thirty-five seconds. Thank you for your patience.
Hadn’t we better run away or something?
(LOOKING AT MAP) Underground. There’s an underground railway, based on the old Dalek mine workings. Which means there should be the entrance to a station...
There! In the corner of the plaza!
FX: AS A HOVERING VEHICLE BEGINS TO DESCEND TOWARDS THEM...
Police are now in attendance. Thank you for your patience.
Run!
FX: THEY RUN. CROSS TO:
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 27
12: INT. STATION ENTRANCE
FX: DOCTOR, KLEIN AND WILL RUNNING IN FROM OUTSIDE.
(RUNNING TO STOP) Surely this is futile..!
(BREATHLESS) The Dalek mines were more extensive than was
shown on the map. If we can just get to the tunnels...
(BREATHLESS) What, we can go underground?
Exactly!
FX: SONIC SCREWDRIVER WHIRR — THE DOCTOR OPERATING ON TICKET
BARRIER. SIMULTANEOUSLY, 3 x JACKBOOTED POLICEMEN RUNNING UP OUTSIDE — ABOUT 100 YARDS AWAY, BUT APPROACHING FAST THROUGH:
Interference with ticket barriers is against local bye-laws!
Don’t worry, there’s a policeman coming...
(LOOKING BEHIND) Several rather large policemen, in fact.
FX: FUSING OF TICKET BARRIER. SONIC SCREWDRIVER OFF.
That’s the barrier dealt with. (GOES THROUGH BARRIER)
(PASSING BARRIER) Come on, Will-!
(ANXIOUS) We’re not fare-dodging, are [we?]
FX: WILL WALKS INTO BARRIER — WHICH CLUNKS SHUT, BLOCKING HIM.
Exit only! Exit only!
I thought you’d screwdrivered this thing, Doctor...!
The entrance barrier, yes!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 28
(TO WILL) You’re trying to go through the exit, you idiot!
FX: CHUNK! FROM BARRIER.
Unauthorised obstruction. Please wait for an attendant.
(STRUGGLING) Now I’ve got my foot stuck in it..! Oh, why is it always me?
Good question!
Too late anyway, with the police coming. You two’d better peg as
Are you sure, Mr Arrowsmith?
I’1l make out I’m just some dim-witted tourist. Which, let’s face, it, is the truth, pretty much. Now go! Go!!!
Against my better judgement...
FX: DOCTOR AND KLEIN RUN OFF AS 3 x POLICE RUN TO HALT BESIDE
WILL.
Officers! You, er, speakee Inglese?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 29
13: INT. COMMS STATION
FX: SQUEAKY FAST-REWIND EFFECT, AS OVER A MONITOR.
Stop. (FX: REWIND STOPS) Play.
FX: A FRAGMENT OF SCENE 11 PLAYED OVER MONITOR:
1 1 _ ee : _ , hed fleet._But} with blood and ingenuity and the strategic application of a baseball bat, they were eventually defeated.
This would have been another of your... interventions, I take LE?
Yes. (BITTERLY) How soon they forget.
Forward.
FX: SQUEAKY FAST-FORWARD EFFECT.
Stop.
FX: REWIND STOPS. PLAY FROM:
(ALOUD, CALLING OUT) Citizens of Azimuth! Don’t you remember? Don’t you care? Don’t you recall... [the]
Stop. (FX: STOP) Load to outbox. Open black comms.
FX: CHIRPY ‘PROGRAM OPENING’ SOUND.
(INTO A MIC) Father. Father. I’m sending you something you should see.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 30
14: INT. CORRECTIONAL FACILITY — GATE/CORRIDOR
FX: BUZZER PRESSED. CLICKS FROM SYSTEM.
(AUTOMATED) Please give your credentials.
Doctors Smith and Klein. We have an appointment to visit prisoner one-one-eight-seven, oblique stroke X.
(ASIDE) And when did you arrange that, exactly?
(ASIDE) Earlier, of course.
Thank you, Re-Educators Smith and Klein. Your appointment is confirmed. (FX: HEAVY ELECTRONIC DOOR UNLOCKING) Please proceed to interview room three.
After you, Dr Klein.
FX: THEY WALK DOWN CORRIDOR.
(SOTTO) ‘Re-Educators’? What’s that about?
(SOTTO) Behavioural psychology, perhaps? Only ‘Re-Educators’ have access to this prisoner, I presume.
(SOTTO) Do you never get tired of working in the dark?
(STOPPING, SOTTO) I do my best work in the dark. (ALOUD) Here
we are. Interview room three.
FX: ANOTHER GATE BUZZES OPEN. FOLLOW THEM THROUGH INTO:
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 31
15: INT. INTERVIEW ROOM
Doctor, that’s —
Prisoner one-one-eight-seven, oblique stroke X. Sit, doctor, sit! The prisoner is safely contained behind a plasteen shield, he can do you no harm.
I'd rather stand.
FX: DOCTOR PULLS UP CHAIR.

DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 19
DOCTOR: The Wraiths of Lemuria. Surviving remnants of a species so obsessed with criminal wrongdoing that they decided to build the largest database of lawbreakers’ DNA in the universe.
WILL: Well, obviously.
DOCTOR: Unfortunately, it took them so long to put their gazillion- name database together, that by the time their Book of All Ills was complete...
KLEIN: Let me guess: everyone in it was centuries dead.
DOCTOR: Precisely. Rather than acknowledge that they’d wasted their entire existence compiling something inherently useless, the Lemurians decided instead to prosecute the living descendants of those named in their Book.
WILL: That hardly seems fair!
DOCTOR: More to the point, since the number of descendants multiplies down the generations, it made virtually everyone guilty of a capital crime.
KLEIN: Hence the deserts of bone dust on their planet.
DOCTOR: What remains of the Lemurians’ essence is little more than a psychic rage, the echo of the howl of the lynch mob.
WILL: But if these Wraiths are so insubstantial, surely they can’t do anyone harm?
DOCTOR: They could haunt you, Mr Arrowsmith.
KLEIN: (HOW ABSURD!) Haunt you!
DOCTOR: Dig into your psyche, whispering your guilt, waking or sleeping... and haunt you to death.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 20
WILL: Doctor, were your ancestors innocent?
DOCTOR: No-one is innocent. (ROUNDING ON KLEIN) Which is why, Elizabeth, I told you to remain in the TARDIS!
KLEIN: I.. forgive me, Doctor. I needed to know.
WILL: (BLITHELY) They’1ll put that on your gravestone, Dr Klein.
KLEIN: (SHARPLY) You said that out loud, Mr Arrowsmith.
WILL: (SHEEPISH) Gosh, I did, didn’t I?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 21
DOCTOR WHO: HEARTBEAT.
BLACK DALEK: Speak!
SCHALK: Schalk. My name is Kurt Schalk. Of that I am certain.
FALKUS: You see, Black Dalek? Three months have passed, but as you see — progress.
BLACK DALEK: The human named Schalk — you will surrender the schematics for the Persuasion device. (BEAT) Now!!!
SCHALK: My name is Kurt Schalk. Hauptsturmftihrer Schalk of the Schutzstaffel — party number one-eight-five, zero-six-nine! And I submit these materials to a superior officer only!
BLACK DALEK: Surrender the schematics, or you will be exterminated!
BLACK DALEK: DALEKS x 3: (A GREEK CHORUS, TO ONE SIDE) Exterminated!!!
SCHALK: Then put me on the train to your Vernichtungslager, your death camp! I give you nothing, Schwarze Dalek!
BLACK DALEK: Falkus. Explain!!!
FALKUS: You heard the Hauptsturmfiihrer. It seems there is no inducement the Daleks can offer, to make him accede.
SCHALK: Ach, I could have betrayed the Reich for an American honey, an English rose, even a big-hipped Russian doll... but break faith with my Flhrer for you croak-voiced Cyclopses? I would sooner die!
BLACK DALEK: Then the Daleks will cut the blueprints from your brain!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 22
FALKUS: Inadvisable, Black Dalek. Data corruption would be... inevitable.
SCHALK: (TRIUMPHANT) Ha!
BLACK DALEK: There is no alternative!
FALKUS: Oh, but I do have another strategy in mind. One with a far greater probability of success.
BLACK DALEK: Then proceed!!!
BLACK DALEK: DALEKS x 3: Proceed! Proceed! Proceed!!!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 23
DOCTOR WHO: IN A WIDE, URBAN, WELL-ORDERED BUT STRANGELY QUIET ENVIRONMENT. TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS.
KLEIN: This is it? This is Azimuth?
WILL: (SURPRISED) Oh! It’s very, um...
DOCTOR: (FX: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) Very what, Mr Arrowsmith?
WILL: . empty, I suppose. Like Canary Wharf on a Sunday.
KLEIN: (FX: WALKING OFF A FEW STEPS) There’s a map over here. A grid of the city, I think. Only it doesn’t say where we are.
MAP VOICE: You are in Monument Plaza.
KLEIN: (STARTLED) Oh! — (BEAT) Monument? I don’t see a monument.
DOCTOR: Behind you.
WILL: It’s a statue. Well, statuette. (FX: WALKS OVER, OTHERS FOLLOW) A naked girl with — is that a baseball bat?
DOCTOR: Yes.
WILL: She seems — I don’t know, familiar.
KLEIN: (TEASING) Does she, Will?
WILL: (BLUSHING) I don’t mean her body. Her face. I’ve seen it somewhere before. (BEAT) There’s an inscription at the bot[trom] — base, I mean.
KLEIN: Was that her name? ‘Liberty’?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 24
DOCTOR: A liberty is what she’d have called it.
WILL: Eh?
DOCTOR: She wasn’t naked, at the time of the Liberation. All those years ago...
KLEIN: (REALISATION) Of course! That’s who she is!
WILL: (BAFFLED) Who-?
KLEIN: The films, from Shoreditch, taken by the Counter-Measures mob — that’s where you’ve seen her before!
WILL: (RECOGNITION) Oh, yes-!
KLEIN: Doctor, she was your companion!
DOCTOR: Ace was her name. Twenty years ago this plaza was a burial pit, and this perfumed air smelled only of putrefaction.
WILL: You’ve been here before.
DOCTOR: It was Azimuth’s misfortune to be positioned as a perfect staging point between two solar systems — the one the invaders came from, and the one they were invading.
WILL: I see.
DOCTOR: The aliens enslaved the colonists, used them to service their fleet. But with blood and ingenuity and the strategic application of a baseball bat, they were eventually defeated.
KLEIN: This would have been another of your... interventions, I take Tt?
DOCTOR: Yes. (BITTERLY) How soon they forget.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 25
WILL: Well, at least they built a statue. (WORRIED) Do people often build naked statues of your companions?
KLEIN: (SARCASTIC) Oh yes. I’m sure it happens all the time.
WILL: (REALLY WORRIED NOW) What, really?
DOCTOR: Look at this plaza. Perfectly paved, not so much as a weed between the flagstones. The windows of the skyscrapers above, glittering in the sun. (FX: CLATTERS SWINGING METAL LID OF NEARBY BIN) Electronic dustbins — all empty. But the bronze of this statue has turned colour, turned to verdigris.
KLEIN: Is that chewing gum, on the end of her bat?
DOCTOR: Most likely. The only object as far as the eye can see that’s in anything other than pristine condition... is Ace’s statue. Oh yes, they forget alright.
WILL: Are you sure you’re not, well, over-reacting?
DOCTOR: (ALOUD, CALLING OUT) Citizens of Azimuth! Don’t you remember? Don’t you care? Don’t you recall... the Daleks?!?
MAP VOICE: (HARSHER NOW) Stay where you are!
WILL: Was that the map?
BIN VOICE: (SIMILAR TO MAP, BUT MALE) Unknown citizens, stay where you are!
KLEIN: And that was the bin.
TANNOY VOICE: The police have been called. Stay where you are!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 26
WILL: (ALARMED) Police-?
DOCTOR: (CALLING INTO AIR) What, just because I said ‘Daleks’?
KLEIN: I assume getting arrested was part of your plan?
DOCTOR: No, in fact. Getting to grid reference 4AA was the plan.
MAP VOICE: Grid number 4AA. Correctional Facility.
KLEIN: A prison! So you did want to get arrested?
DOCTOR: No, I wanted to visit. Actually being incarcerated would be most unhelpful.
TANNOY VOICE: Police response time currently standing at thirty-five seconds. Thank you for your patience.
WILL: Hadn’t we better run away or something?
DOCTOR: (LOOKING AT MAP) Underground. There’s an underground railway, based on the old Dalek mine workings. Which means there should be the entrance to a station...
KLEIN: There! In the corner of the plaza!
TANNOY VOICE: Police are now in attendance. Thank you for your patience.
DOCTOR: Run!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 27
KLEIN: (RUNNING TO STOP) Surely this is futile..!
DOCTOR: (BREATHLESS) The Dalek mines were more extensive than was
DOCTOR: shown on the map. If we can just get to the tunnels...
WILL: (BREATHLESS) What, we can go underground?
DOCTOR: Exactly!
DOCTOR: BARRIER. SIMULTANEOUSLY, 3 x JACKBOOTED POLICEMEN RUNNING UP OUTSIDE — ABOUT 100 YARDS AWAY, BUT APPROACHING FAST THROUGH:
TICKET BARRIER VOICE: Interference with ticket barriers is against local bye-laws!
DOCTOR: Don’t worry, there’s a policeman coming...
WILL: (LOOKING BEHIND) Several rather large policemen, in fact.
DOCTOR: That’s the barrier dealt with. (GOES THROUGH BARRIER)
KLEIN: (PASSING BARRIER) Come on, Will-!
WILL: (ANXIOUS) We’re not fare-dodging, are [we?]
TICKET BARRIER VOICE: Exit only! Exit only!
WILL: I thought you’d screwdrivered this thing, Doctor...!
DOCTOR: The entrance barrier, yes!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 28
KLEIN: (TO WILL) You’re trying to go through the exit, you idiot!
TICKET BARRIER VOICE: Unauthorised obstruction. Please wait for an attendant.
WILL: (STRUGGLING) Now I’ve got my foot stuck in it..! Oh, why is it always me?
KLEIN: Good question!
WILL: Too late anyway, with the police coming. You two’d better peg as
DOCTOR: Are you sure, Mr Arrowsmith?
WILL: I’1l make out I’m just some dim-witted tourist. Which, let’s face, it, is the truth, pretty much. Now go! Go!!!
DOCTOR: Against my better judgement...
DOCTOR: WILL.
WILL: Officers! You, er, speakee Inglese?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 29
QAREN: Stop. (FX: REWIND STOPS) Play.
DOCTOR: 1 1 _ ee : _ , hed fleet._But} with blood and ingenuity and the strategic application of a baseball bat, they were eventually defeated.
KLEIN: This would have been another of your... interventions, I take LE?
DOCTOR: Yes. (BITTERLY) How soon they forget.
QAREN: Forward.
QAREN: Stop.
DOCTOR: (ALOUD, CALLING OUT) Citizens of Azimuth! Don’t you remember? Don’t you care? Don’t you recall... [the]
QAREN: Stop. (FX: STOP) Load to outbox. Open black comms.
QAREN: (INTO A MIC) Father. Father. I’m sending you something you should see.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 30
GATE VOICE: (AUTOMATED) Please give your credentials.
DOCTOR: Doctors Smith and Klein. We have an appointment to visit prisoner one-one-eight-seven, oblique stroke X.
KLEIN: (ASIDE) And when did you arrange that, exactly?
DOCTOR: (ASIDE) Earlier, of course.
GATE VOICE: Thank you, Re-Educators Smith and Klein. Your appointment is confirmed. (FX: HEAVY ELECTRONIC DOOR UNLOCKING) Please proceed to interview room three.
DOCTOR: After you, Dr Klein.
KLEIN: (SOTTO) ‘Re-Educators’? What’s that about?
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Behavioural psychology, perhaps? Only ‘Re-Educators’ have access to this prisoner, I presume.
KLEIN: (SOTTO) Do you never get tired of working in the dark?
DOCTOR: (STOPPING, SOTTO) I do my best work in the dark. (ALOUD) Here
DOCTOR: we are. Interview room three.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 31
KLEIN: Doctor, that’s —
DOCTOR: Prisoner one-one-eight-seven, oblique stroke X. Sit, doctor, sit! The prisoner is safely contained behind a plasteen shield, he can do you no harm.
KLEIN: I'd rather stand.
DOCTOR: (SITS) Suit yourself. (TO PRISONER) Prisoner one-one-eight- seven. Look at us, please.
CLONE SCHALK: (FX: ALL HIS DIALOGUE BEHIND SHIELD, LIKE GLASS) I have nothing to say to you.
DOCTOR: That’s an interesting accent, Prisoner. Now where on Earth did you pick that up?
DOCTOR: I find that eye contact does help with the process.
CLONE SCHALK: There is no point to this process. I tell you people what happened, and you tell me I am wrong, and that I must be re- educated. On and on and on it goes, and I am tired now.
DOCTOR: What if I were to address you by your name? What if I were to call you Schalk? Kurt Schalk? — Look at me, please.
CLONE SCHALK: No, you are Re-educators. You will trick me into telling my story again, and then you will say it is wrong, and then you will give me treatment. And I told you, I am tired.
KLEIN: Kurt. Please, don’t you remember us? Don’t you remember me?
CLONE SCHALK: Everything I remember is wrong!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001)
KLEIN: Look at me, Kurt. Look at me. Remember.
DOCTOR: We’re here to help.
CLONE SCHALK: (REMEMBERING) Here... to help...?
DUB IN: FROM ‘PERSUASION’, SCENE 23:
HINTERBERGER: Wait. You. The Fraulein in the shadows.
HINTERBERGER: Step forward, I say!
KLEIN: I presume you’re referring to me.
CLONE SCHALK: Am I dreaming...?
HINTERBERGER: Page 32
HINTERBERGER: Step forward.
HINTERBERGER: Am I dreaming? Is it really you, returned?
CLONE SCHALK: No. No, not you. I must not remember-!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 33
QAREN: (WALKING IN) Visitor Arrowsmith?
WILL: Yes, that’s me. Hello.
QAREN: (ALOUD) Visitor Arrowsmith. My name is Superintendent Qaren. [PRONOUNCIATION: ‘KAA-REN’.] (FORMAL) Having reviewed the
QAREN: evidence from Monument Plaza, I am satisfied that you personally made no public or private reference to Events That Did Not Occur. You are free to go.
WILL: What, really? Only the other policemen threatened me with something called ‘re-education’, every time I said Da-
QAREN: (URGENT, SOTTO) Don’t say it. You mustn’t say it!
WILL: (SOTTO) What, Da-
QAREN: (SOTTO) I mean it. They’re listening.
WILL: (SOTTO) Who is?
QAREN: (SOTTO) Everyone.
WILL: (SOTTO) I’m afraid I don’t understand any of this.
QAREN: (SOTTO) I can’t explain, not here. There’s someone who wants to meet you. You and your... associates.
WILL: (SOTTO) The Doctors, you mean?
QAREN: (FORMAL) Should you again encounter the individual hitherto unknown to you who made such illicit references, you will of course report their location to this Station of Police.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 34
WILL: Yes, I’1l be... sure to do so.
QAREN: (SOTTO) There’s a hovercar pool two blocks to your right. Meet me there, five minutes.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: LIKE GLASS.
DOCTOR WHO: DUB IN, FROM ‘PERSUASION’, SCENE 25:
HINTERBERGER: Ach, is there nothing you creatures will not stoop to?
CLONE SCHALK: . Bringing her here, to me to get me to talk?
KLEIN: You do remember-!
CLONE SCHALK: There are voices, in my mind. Such strange voices...
CLONE SCHALK: DUB IN, FROM CLONE-SCHALK’S MEMORIES:
BLACK DALEK: You will remember!
DOCTOR: Dr Klein’s voice? Is that whose voice you mean, Schalk?
DOCTOR: DUB IN, FROM CLONE-SCHALK’S MEMORIES:
BLACK DALEK: Remember!!!
CLONE SCHALK: There are.. other voices. Terrible, croaking, alien voices...
KLEIN: Dalek voices.
CLONE SCHALK: Can’t you hear then-? Don’t you see-?! They are among us. Everywhere, among us! There are Daleks among us!!! (LAUGHS
MANICALLY THROUGH: )
KLEIN: At last. Now we’re getting somewhere.
DOCTOR: I’m afraid not. Look at his eyes.
KLEIN: Well, what about them-?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 36
DOCTOR: (LOUDLY) I think I’ve seen enough. Come along, Dr Klein.
KLEIN: Doctor? Where are you going?
DOCTOR: (ALOUD) As I thought, the prisoner is a hopeless case. Now, Dr Klein!
CLONE SCHALK: (LAUGHING) You mustn’t tell! You mustn’t say! But they are
CLONE SCHALK: among us! The Daleks are among [us!!!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 37
QAREN: (IN CAR) Arrowsmith! Visitor Arrowsmith!
WILL: Oh! There you are, Superintendent —
QAREN: In, quickly! There’s only a narrow window in the grid!
WILL: (GETTING IN) Window?
QAREN: The surveillance grid, idiot!
WILL: Hang on, should we be doing this —
WILL: . waaaah! (BEAT) When you said ‘hover’, I imagined something rather more graceful.
QAREN: (DRIVING THROUGHOUT) There’s a critical path, past the surveillance scans. That way, we can get you to Father’s unseen.
WILL: It’s your father wants to meet me?
QAREN: No! I mean — ‘Father’, like a priest.
WILL: You’re taking me to church-?
QAREN: To his house, in the country. It’s not far.
WILL: A priest wants to talk to me about Da— (STOPS HIMSELF) Sorry, forgot, I’m not supposed to say it.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 38
QAREN: It’s alright, it’s safe in here. (GATHERS HERSELF) ‘Daleks’, yes. (BREATHES OUT) It’s so.. exciting, saying that to a stranger.
WILL: What, ‘Daleks’?
QAREN: I know you know about what happened here, twenty years ago.
WILL: The invasion, yes. My friend the Doctor was there.
QAREN: I gathered. What you don’t understand, Arrowsmith —
WILL: Will, please. —
QAREN: What you don’t understand, Will, is that for the last three years the invasion didn’t happen. By law, it’s no longer part of Azimuth’s past.
WILL: What? But you can’t just say something didn’t happen, if it did-!
QAREN: You don’t get it. When the Daleks invaded, they... they made people work for them.
WILL: Yes, as slaves. The Doctor said.
QAREN: Not just as slaves. As collaborators and informants, willing to do whatever they had to just to survive. Willing to murder, and worse.
WILL: Right, gosh.
QAREN: After the war, this world became ungovernable, riven by recriminations. Neighbour turned on neighbour. Ethnic group turned on ethnic group. There was violence. Terrible, bloody, violence...
WILL: It must have been awful.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 39
QAREN: Long after the Daleks were defeated, the city below was a warzone. It seemed like Azimuth would destroy itself. Until, one day, someone wondered: what if we just forgot? What if we made it illegal to remember?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 40
GATE VOICE: Thank you for visiting this facility.
KLEIN: What are you playing at, Doctor? Schalk was just beginning to open up. He was telling us about the —
DOCTOR: This is a society in deep denial of its past. Just saying that one little word starting with ‘D’ is enough to get you locked up and ‘re-educated’.
KLEIN: Of course! That’s why the police came after us!
DOCTOR: They have eyes and ears everywhere, I think. We’d better find out what’s happened to Mr Arrowsmith, before he digs himself into a deeper hole than he undoubtedly has already.
KLEIN: And then what? You won’t get another chance to talk to Schalk.
DOCTOR: That wasn’t Kurt Schalk, Elizabeth.
KLEIN: Oh, come on. Everything he said. Everything he remembered —
DOCTOR: Partially remembered. (STOPS; LIKEWISE KLEIN) But whoever — whatever — that person was, his eyes were blue. Not brown, like the real Kurt Schalk’s. Blue. How do you account for that, Dr Klein?
KLEIN: I — I’m not sure.
DOCTOR: It’s a quirk of cloning technology. Specifically, a quirk of (HUSHED) the Dees’ duplication technology. The eyes never go quite right.
KLEIN: The (HUSHED) Dees copied Schalk?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 41
DOCTOR: Undoubtedly.
KLEIN: Well, why?
DOCTOR: I don’t know. What’s more interesting is when.
KLEIN: How do you mean?
DOCTOR: Prisoner one-one-eight-seven, oblique stroke X was first admitted to this facility five months ago.
KLEIN: But the war was twenty years in the past! (EXCITED, FORGETTING HERSELF) The clone Schalk was right! They’re here! There are Da-
DOCTOR: Ssh, Dr Klein. (HUSHED) There are Dees among us. I know.
KLEIN: Do you think they’ve still got him? The real Schalk?
DOCTOR: Perhaps. What happened to him, I wonder...?
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 42
DOCTOR WHO: HEARTBEAT.
SCHALK: My name is Hauptsturmfiihrer Kurt Schalk. You have tortured me. You have performed surgery on my brain. You have made deranged doppelgangers of me in your duplication vats. —
FALKUS: In this, I concede defeat. Precise duplication of mental engrams is beyond Dalek technology, it seems.
SCHALK: Six months later, and still — still! — you do not know the secrets of the Persuasion Machine. Schwarze Dalek, you have failed!!!
BLACK DALEK: I — we — cannot fail! You will surrender the schematics! You must surrender the schematics!
SCHALK: No. For I have resisted all your privations! I am the superior being! I am the Superman, and you the pitiful Untermensch!
BLACK DALEK: No. We are the superior beings... and you will be exterminated!
BLACK DALEK: Extermination squad — obey!!!
DALEK: No.
BLACK DALEK: (UNFAMILIAR WITH CONCEPT) You — dis-obey???
DALEK: The human Kurt Schalk may not be exterminated, by order of the Supreme Dalek.
SCHALK: Hal!!!
BLACK DALEK: I have received no such order from the Supreme Dalek.
FALKUS: You have not, no.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 43
BLACK DALEK: I do not understand.
SCHALK: Unlike you, Schwarze Dalek, young Herr Falkus is a realist. He understood from the first that a proud officer of the Reich may not be forcibly coerced.
BLACK DALEK: What does this mean?!
FALKUS: The Supreme Dalek has agreed to this human's... conditions.
BLACK DALEK: Daleks do not agree with conditions!
SCHALK: Your Supreme does. I will help the Daleks build the Persuasion Machine... on the condition of their absolute loyalty... to me! Extermination squad — assemble!!!
SCHALK: DALEKS x 3: We obey.
BLACK DALEK: No. No! I am the superior Dalek!
SCHALK: Exterminate squad — exterminate!!!
BLACK DALEK: No. No. No. —
BLACK DALEK: BEAT.
SCHALK: On the contrary, Schwarze Dalek. I am the Fuhrer of the Daleks now.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 44
QAREN: Out you get, Mr Arrowsmith.
WILL: (WALKING) It’s rather grand, isn’t it? For a priest’s house.
QAREN: (WALKING) They housed veterans of the war here, once. Father is the last of them. (STOPPING AT DOOR) Will. I should explain — when you see him — Father is not quite.. normal.
WILL: What do you mean?
QAREN: (CALLING) Father! Father, it’s only me! (TO WILL) There were things the Daleks did to him, in their torture camps. Things that... changed him. (FX: AS THE ELECTRONICALLY-CONTROLLED DOOR BEGINS TO OPEN...) Just... try not to be shocked when you meet him, that’s all.
QAREN: FROM INSIDE...
QAREN: Father. There you are. This is the one I told you about. This is Will Arrowsmith.
WILL: (STEPPING UP TO DOOR) It’s a pleasure to meet you, sir.
DAVROS: It is a pleasure to meet you too, my boy. Please — come in, and tell me about the Daleks.
DAVROS: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 45

elements.text: PART TWO
FX: .. AS A CERTAIN SOMEONE GLIDES UP FROM INSIDE...
Father. There you are. This is the one I told you about. This
is Will Arrowsmith.
(STEPPING UP TO DOOR) It’s a pleasure to meet you, sir.
It is a pleasure to meet you too, my boy. Please — come in, and tell me about the Daleks.
22: INT. HALLWAY
FX: DAVROS MOVES ASIDE TO LET QAREN AND WILL IN.
In, in!
Thank you, sir.
FX: QAREN CLOSES DOOR BEHIND.
There is no need for such formality. ‘Father’ will do.
Don’t worry — we can all speak freely, Will. There’s a dead spot in the surveillance scans right above the house.
Oh! Well, that’s handy.
(DURR!) I fixed it that way, obviously.
It is helpful that the Superintendent shares our... concerns.
When we intercept chatter about the Daleks, we’re supposed to pass it immediately downstairs, to the Re-education Department.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 46
Instead, Qaren deletes it from the record... and brings it straight to me.
But why, sir? — I mean, Father. Actually, I’d rather use ‘sir’, I think, if that’s alright.
Quite alright, my boy.
It’s just — the war’s been over for twenty years. What use is information about the Daleks?
I should have thought that was obvious, to a boy of such obvious intelligence.
They’re still here?
There are Daleks among us, Will. Everywhere, among us! They never left!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 47
23: EXT. MONUMENT PLAZA
FX: SOUNDS OF DEMOLITION FROM OFF, AS DOCTOR AND KLEIN EXIT
THE STATION AND STOP.
Here we are. Monument Plaza.
What is it they’re doing over there?
Demolishing Ace’s statue. Someone must have noted the oversight.
No sign of Will, unless he’s in the TARDIS.
More likely Mr Arrowsmith is currently helping the police with their enquiries.
I’ve been guilty, I think, of underestimating that young man. He isn’t quite so hopeless in the field as I thought.
(SURPRISED) You think so?

We should at least check. (LEADINGLY...) Besides, it might be useful to carry out a topographical scan of the city from the TARDIS, too. If there really are (HUSHED) Dees among us, they have to be hiding somewhere.
True, but...
Now, I have an idea how to get past those workmen without drawing any unwanted attention. (WALKS OFF) Follow me.
Elizabeth? (FOLLOWING) Elizabeth, wait-!
FX: BESIDE WORKMEN, SMASHING ACE’S STATUE. WORKMEN BREAK OFF
AS KLEIN APPROACHES.
You looking at something, lady?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 48
I am looking at nothing. Nothing is happening here. Nothing at all.
That’s right.
Least of all, the demolition of a statuette of Liberty.
(MENACINGLY) What’s your name? Only it sounds to me like you might have seen something...
(COMING UP BEHIND) Elizabeth, be careful.
I am Re-educator Klein, my colleague here is Re-educator Smith.
(PANIC-STRICKEN) You’re Re-educators-?
We’ve not seen you, and you’ve not seen us.
Now, carry on with what you weren’t doing.
Yes, Re-educators!
FX: WORKMEN RESUME SMASHING STATUE.

DOCTOR: Because Schalk is her father, of course. (TO SELF) Oh, Elizabeth. I warned you.
SCHALK: If that is what happens, then she knows. She knows what she is!
WILL: (PEDANTIC) ‘Who’ she is.
SCHALK: (DARK) I meant what I said, Herr Arrowsmith.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 106
VOLKENRATH: Please, don’t kill me. Please!
KLEIN: Now, Fraulein Volkenrath — tell me everything.
VOLKENRATH: About what?
KLEIN: About the child.. and the Persuasion Machine. Everything!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 107
SCHALK: What is the Persuasion Machine, Doctor? — Why, a device to infiltrate minds, to make one person’s will manifest in the minds of many.
DALEK: A device to instil total obedience to Dalek control!
SCHALK: Perhaps. But the design has... limitations.
DOCTOR: What limitations, Schalk?
DALEK: The feeble potential of the human mind!
WILL: Human minds aren’t feeble. Well, not all of them.
DOCTOR: Hush, Mr Arrowsmith.
WILL: sorry.
SCHALK: The Dalek is partly correct. He who operates the Machine must have a particularly... rigorous mind, free of doubts and other emotional frailties, else there is a risk that those very uncertainties could be magnified in those made subject to Persuasion.
DOCTOR: An unbending ideologue. Not the sort of personality in short supply in Nazi Germany.
WILL: So who’d the operator have been? Not — you know, Hitler?
SCHALK: Even the Fuhrer had his weaknesses. No, the operator would have to be carefully chosen. Someone whose mind had not been softened by life’s little traumas.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 108
DOCTOR: Someone inculcated from birth with nothing but a few, very narrow beliefs. A blank canvas on which to paint your propaganda!
WILL: From birth? You mean, a child?
SCHALK: Of course, a child!
DOCTOR: (RECALLING HIS EARLIER WORDS) “Some blank space. Some void.”
WILL: The baby. Dr Klein. Dr Klein was supposed to operate the Machine!
DOCTOR: Yes. A designer baby, manufactured for one purpose only!
SCHALK: You choose your words with precision, Doctor. You realise the scale of our ambitions.
WILL: Manufactured? You mean, Dr Klein wasn’t born in the ordinary way?
DOCTOR: She was grown in their lab, to precise specifications.
WILL: Well, why?
SCHALK: So we could make more of her, of course! Even the most perfect operator could only project a Persuasion Field across a finite radius. The sphere of influence of one Machine might only extend some fifty kilometres wide.
DOCTOR: To subjugate a world, a galaxy, a universe — you’d have to mass-produce operators for mass-produced Persuasion Machines!
WILL: And Dr Klein was the first!
SCHALK: The template, yes.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 109
DOCTOR WHO: FRANKENSTEIN STYLE ELECTRICAL ARC IN B/G. DOORS.
CLONE QAREN: Falkus. I bring prisoner Davros, as instructed.
FALKUS: Good. Good! I have been waiting for this!
FALKUS: DOORS CLOSE.
DAVROS: (ENTERING) You are Falkus? I hear intriguing reports of your work.
FALKUS: Well, I am eager to show it to you.
DAVROS: (STOPPING, LOOKING AROUND) Wait. This laboratory seems — familiar.
FALKUS: It is an exact duplicate of your own, when you were the youngest and most brilliant member of the Kaled elite!
DAVROS: For what purpose? Do you presume to follow my achievements?
FALKUS: (MOVING TO PANEL) Here, let me show you something. —
FALKUS: GLASS, SIMILAR FX TO ‘GENESIS OF THE DALEKS’.
FALKUS: I have replicated a number of your early experiments. Such pioneering work!
DAVROS: Such filthy mutations were but one of the steps taken on my journey to creating the Daleks. (IRRITATED) And their insane shrieking blocks my audio receptors!
FALKUS: Of course, I apologise.
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 110
DAVROS: To what end would you remake these abominations?
FALKUS: To no end, Davros. Other than to — get inside your head, I suppose.
DAVROS: I did not come here to Azimuth to be hero-worshipped. But if you wish to please me, Falkus, if you crave my attention —
FALKUS: I do, yes. I will admit to that. —
DAVROS: . then you may begin by updating me on the progress of Research Project Nine-Zero-Zero-One!
FALKUS: Nine-Zero-Zero...?
DAVROS: The reason why this bunker was established, twenty years ago. The reason why the Daleks went underground, to preserve and protect the Project throughout its... incubation. The reason why I returned to this world, all those months ago!
FALKUS: The reason, too, why the Daleks have been holding you prisoner.
DAVROS: I do not understand.
FALKUS: Project Nine-Zero-Zero-One: “To grow, from tissue supplied by the Creator, a renewed physical form into which his consciousness can be downloaded at a time when his own body becomes no longer viable.”
DAVROS: A Project dear to my own artificial heart, I’m sure you can appreciate. Now I would know the result!
FALKUS: But don’t you see? The result is here!
DAVROS: I do not understand.
FALKUS: Father, it has been a brilliant success!
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 111
DAVROS: ‘Father’-?!
FALKUS: I am Project Nine-Zero-Zero-One! I am your heir. Your successor!
FALKUS: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 112

elements.text: PART FOUR
NO REPRISE
57: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
FX: DALEK HEARTBEAT.
I confirm: duplication plant is ready to commence production of multiple Elizabeth Kleins!
You’ll have to find her first!
Doctor - you will find a way bring her back to Azimuth, [or..!]
I fear that won’t be possible, Herr Schalk.
Do this, or your associate dies!!!
Don’t you understand, she should already be here! My TARDIS was set to Fast Return. It should have transported Dr Klein back to Monument Plaza mere microseconds after she left!
Then what has gone wrong?
I don’t know.
The bunker in Dusseldorf was littered with corpses...
Germany was a dangerous place to be in April, 1945.
(TACTLESS) Then again, if the Dr Klein I know found out what she really was; if she realised the danger her existence posed...
There is another possibility. If she were to have held the baby, her younger self — the Blinovitch Effect would have kicked in, and whoosh! History’s web would have altered.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 113
Altered [how-?]
(EXCITEDLY) Alert! Alert! Materialisation reported in Monument Plaza!
Activate external scanners!
FX: OFF, SCREEN FLARES INTO LIFE. WE HEAR THE END OF THE
TARDIS MATERIALISING, PERHAPS IN A RATHER MORE DRAWN-OUT FASHION THAN USUAL, IN MONUMENT PLAZA ABOVE.
The TARDIS!
(MISERABLY) Of course, close proximity to her younger self could easily cause a few wrinkles in spacetime. Enough to knock my TARDIS a couple of hours off course...
(TO DALEK) Despatch a squad to pick its occupant up! I want that woman here!!!
At once!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 114
58: INT. FALKUS’S LAB
FX: AS BEFORE.
You dare to nominate yourself my heir, Falkus-?!
The son succeeds the father. It is just the way of things.
It is not the way of the Daleks!!!
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
(TROTTING IN SHARPLY) Falkus! Hauptsturmfiihrer Schalk reports that the woman Elizabeth Klein has returned to Azimuth!
This woman Klein is of no interest!
Far from it, ‘Father’. (TO QAREN) I must go. Duplicate — Davros cannot be granted unrestricted access to my work.
These experiments of yours are not work, they are plagiarism!
(IGNORING HIM, HEADING TO DOOR) Containment Vault Six is empty. Place Davros inside it, and freeze him.
I obey!
You would treat me, your creator, in such a fashion?
Creator once. But all you are to me now is archival material. A back-up for a master work! (EXITS)
FX: DOOR SLIDES SHUT.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 115
59: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
NB: WHEN VOLKENRATH ENTERS, EVERYONE WILL BELIEVE SHE’S KLEIN — INCLUDING THE LISTENERS, UNTIL THE VERY END OF THE PLAY.
FX: DALEK HEARTBEAT.
What’s happening? Report!
(SWIVELLING) Elizabeth Klein is now under Dalek escort!
Excellent!
(ASIDE) Doctor: if Dr Klein really is the key to controlling the Persuasion Machine... then Schalk, and the Daleks — well, they’ve won!
I’m well aware of that, Mr Arrowsmith.
FX: DOORS SLIDE OPEN.
Ah! At last!
Prisoner Klein — proceed!
Your entreaties are... unnecessary. I meet my destiny gladly!
FX: SHE MARCHES IN, JACKBOOTS CLOPPING.
(SEEING HER UNIFORM) Oh, no —
Dr Klein? Why are you wearing those clothes?
The young Herr asks a fair question. Please, account for this uniform!
Am I not entitled to wear it, Hauptsturmfiihrer? Am I not a product of the Schutzstaffel?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 116
Put like that... I can only approve.
(RUSHING FORWARD) Elizabeth, no! You are so much more than a product!
(DISDAINFUL) Ah, the Umbrella Man. Where I have come from, they have an idea of how best to treat vexatious aliens.
Dr Klein? What happened, to make you like this? To make you speak like this...?
. and here is young Arrowsmith. Is it too late to save you from becoming infected by the alien Doctor’s ideas? — Yes, I fear that it might be.
The junge has asked a fair question! Tell me, Dr Klein — what happened in Dusseldorf, after you left me?
In Dusseldorf, Hauptsturmftihrer? I saw... myself.
(EXCITED) Fraulein Volkenrath, you mean?
I... listened as she described to me my purpose, my place in the scheme of things. And then, quite suddenly, it was like a light switched on in my head — a sudden, dazzling light!
A revelation!
More likely an explosion. An American-made incendiary device.
What, she’s shellshocked?
Undoubtedly.
In a moment, it was all so clear - I had to come here, to embrace my destiny! To operate the Persuasion Machine!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 117
60: INT. FALKUS’S LAB
FX: AS BEFORE.
Prisoner Davros will now enter the Vault.
Qaren, my dear... that will not be necessary.
I am not Qaren. I am a Dalek duplicate. I must summon assistance. (CALLING) Daleks! [Da-] (CUT SHORT IMMEDIATELY
(COMMANDINGLY) Father knows best!
(DULLY) Father... knows... best.

Since the Dalek duplication process duplicates almost everything of the original... it is as well that I troubled myself to instil certain hypnotic commands into the psyche of my tame policewoman, is it not?
Father knows best.
Always, dear Qaren. Always!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 118
61: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
FX: HEARTBEAT. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
(ENTERING) So, she is here. Dr Elizabeth Klein.
Herr Falkus? I did not summon you.
Oh, but I had to come — Herr Schalk.
Falkus, yes. An interesting name — the name of the second moon of the Daleks’ home planet, as I now recall.
Your knowledge of Dalek history is indeed as encyclopaedic as your reputation suggests, Doctor. It is an old Kaled word. It means —
‘New Dawn’. Roughly translated.
What is ‘Kaled’?
It’s an anagram, right?
The Daleks’ ancestors. Blond-haired, blue-eyed... well, for the most part. Very much like Herr Falkus, in fact.
Then the Daleks are of good stock. This explains much.
The point is, the Kaleds went extinct. So what’s Falkus doing here — if, as seems likely, he is indeed a pureblood Kaled?
Why, Doctor — running this entire operation, of course.
Ha! Young Herr, I would hardly call your science projects ‘this entire operation’!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 119

No? Since I came of age, three years ago, I have been managing the citystate on Azimuth above. When rumours about the Persuasion Machine began to echo around the cosmos, it was I who foresaw its potential, and devised a plan to acquire it. And it was I who permitted you, ‘Hauptsturmfiihrer', to believe that you were the leader of the Daleks, to give me time to recover its blueprints at my leisure!
My authority here was granted by the Supreme Dalek! Daleks! My Daleks! Arrest Herr Falkus, he has gone mad! He endangers our great project!
(COOLLY) No.
Daleks obey only the Supreme Dalek.
Exactly, and the Supreme Dalek has invested his authority in me! Arrest Falkus.
I repeat, Daleks obey only the Supreme Dalek.
Isn’t it obvious, Schalk? Falkus is the Supreme Dalek.
What?
I understand little of this. Are you saying Herr Schalk is not in charge?
By the sounds of it, he never has been.
(SNEERY) Your ‘great project’, Schalk. Some ignoble Fourth Reich — annexing the stars, with the Daleks as your stormtroopers!
The battle was lost on Earth — but yes, yes! The war must continue!
It will. But not your war, Kurt Schalk. Daleks — my Daleks — please, exterminate this Nazi.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 120
DALEKS x 3: (GLIDING FORWARD) We obey!!!
No! No! The blueprints, for the Machine! Remember, they are still inside my head. Kill me, and they will be gone — poof! All gone!
They are already gone from your head, fool. Slowly, carefully, surgically extracted by Dalek mind probe technology every night you slept the past five months.
Impossible!
You were kept alive to help facilitate the Operator’s arrival. But now, with the Doctor’s assistance, this woman is our possession, and So...
I am no-one’s possession!
(IGNORING HER) Daleks - proceed.
No! Daleks, please! We have so much in common. Together, we
could build something shining, something beautiful!
The Daleks are the master race.
There cannot be another.
No — no, you can’t!
DALEKS x 3: EXTERMINATE!!!
FX: DALEK DEATH RAYS.
SCREAMS AND DIES
Hauptsturmftithrer Schalk...!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 121
Elizabeth — whatever’s going on in your head right now, I urge you to remember: this is not your destiny.
Umbrella Man, what I have learned today, if I did not know it already, is this: that resistance is futile.
DALEKS x 3: (LIKE SHE SAID ‘CRACKERJACK!’) Resistance is futile!!!
The Daleks are not your destiny!
You can fight them! You can still resist!
You Dalek — take the Doctor’s assistant to my laboratory and put him into storage. He may assist me in my experiments!
What, you think I’1l help you-?!
With your brain extracted from your skull, you will have little choice.
Falkus, no!
(JOSTLING WILL OUT) Proceed-!
(SHOVED OUT OF DOOR) Doctor, you mustn’t blame yourself. It was my own stupid need to know-!
You Daleks — escort Dr Klein to the duplication plant.
DALEKS x 2: We obey!
FX: 2 x DALEKS AND VOLKENRATH EXIT.
What about me, Falkus? What horror have you planned for me?
Now, Doctor — that would be telling.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 122
62: INT. FALKUS’S LAB
FX: DOOR OPENS.
(HERDING WILL IN) Enter!!!
I don’t much like being pushed around, especially not by you lot! — Oh. Sorry, I don’t quite know where that came from.
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Why is Arrowsmith here?
Qaren-!
The human is to be stored for vivisection.
I understand. (FX: OPENS DOOR TO SIDE VAULT — HEAVY HYDRAULICS) Containment Vault Six is free.
(TO WILL) Move!!!
(BEING PUSHED) Alright-! (TO QAREN) No, you’re not Qaren, are you? I can tell by the eyes. It’s a shame, she seemed nice. Well, apart from the father issues.
Enter the vault!
One moment. (SHOVING WILL) Out of the way, Arrowsmith! — There’s something in there already, Dalek — do you see?
(TRUNDLING FORWARD INTO VAULT) What is it you perceive in here?
You. (SHOVES DALEK — EFFORT) Arrowsmith, the lock!
FX: LOCK ACTIVATED — DALEK SHUT IN SMULTANEOUSLY WITH:
What is the meaning of [this?]
FX: LOCK CLUNKS SHUT.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 123
(EXHALING) Qaren — if you are a Dalek duplicate, then what is the meaning of this?
(TRUNDLING IN FROM OFF) The meaning, Mr Arrowsmith, is that Father knows best!
Father knows best!
(GROANS) Oh, no.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 124
63: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
FX: HEARTBEAT. THE DOCTOR HAS BEEN PLACED INTO AN ELECTRONIC
TORTURE CHAIR — IDENTICAL TO THE ONE SARAH AND HARRY WERE PUT INTO IN ‘GENESIS OF THE DALEKS’.
The Doctor is installed in the agony seat!
(STRAPPED ACROSS CHEST, RESTRICTED) ‘Agony seat’, Falkus? To tell the truth, it’s rather nice to be able to take the weight off my feet. I’m getting on, you know.
You recognize this instrument, of course. It is the means by which Davros once extricated from you tactical information regarding future Dalek defeats.
All those years ago, on Skaro. I remember the routine.
The original recordings were destroyed, of course. But upon his later revival, my fa— (CORRECTS HIMSELF) — Davros recalled
enough of the detail to program Dalek data banks with the information.
Then why would you want to go over all that again?
I do not. In fact, I have ensured that your past revelations have been purged from those very datasets. A race that cannot make its own mistakes, and learn from them, risks mental atrophy.
That shows a certain wisdom. Congratulations, Falkus! — You've barely started shaving, and you’re already twice the man your ‘father’ is.
Davros is not my father!
Have it your way.
Besides, there will be no future Dalek defeats — on the planets Earth, or Mars, or Hyperon — once the Persuasion programme takes effect throughout the universe!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 125
Oh, so you’re about to torture me for fun-? I take it back, you are a chip off the old block after all.
It is not Dalek defeats that I wish to prevent, Doctor. This time, it is your little victories I wish to undo.
I don’t understand.
Every world you have saved from destruction, or worse. Every life you have preserved, from kings and regents down to peasants and serfs - down through the basest of creatures to insects, even!
The butterfly effect.

I would know every virtuous deed you have ever done, Doctor, so my Daleks can seek out every corner of the universe in which you have made your mark... and scrub you from future history. Dalek — let the agony begin!
I obey!
FX: AGONY SEAT BEGINS THROBBING AT A LOW LEVEL.
WINCES, GASPS
Too low, Dalek! Turn it up, we do not have all day!
FX: AGONY SEAT GOES FROM 20 TO 80 MPH, AS IT WERE.
SCREAMS
(OVER THIS) Relate to me every last victory, Doctor! Tell me! Tell me! TELL — ME!!!
Tell! Tell! TELLLLLL!
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 126
64: INT. DUPLICATION PLANT
FX: IMAGINE GIANT MOULDS PRESSING TOGETHER — WHOMP!; THEN

COMING APART TO REVEAL A KLEIN CLONE; WHICH STEPS OFF PRODUCTION LINE AND SALUTES A DALEK. EACH ONE OF THESE THREE STEPS IS OCCURRING SIMULTANEOUSLY, CREATING MULTIPLE CLONES: SO AS ONE MOULD WHOMPS, ANOTHER IS COMING APART, AND A CLONE IS STEPPING DOWN AND SALUTING.
I am the Machine incarnate.
Confirm your allegiance!
I serve the will of the Daleks!
FX: EACH CLONE THEN MARCHES OFF. PROCESS REPEATS AS WE CROSS
TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE PLANT, WHERE DAVROS GLIDES IN, FLANKED BY WILL AND CLONE QAREN.
Mass duplication has already commenced!
(HISSED) Keep it down, Davros! I can’t help you if the Daleks raise the alarm!
(SOTTO) The template is unattended.
SOTTO) That’ll be my chance, then. (MAKES TO LEAVE
Wait. — You are certain the woman will listen to you?
(SOTTO) If there’s anything left of the Dr Klein I used to know — maybe. Or maybe not. She was always a bit unapproachable.
FX: UP DUPLICATION SOUNDS AS WE FOLLOW WILL CLOSER TO THE
LINE, WHERE VOLKENRATH IS INSTALLED IN SOME SORT OF BOOTH.
Dr Klein! .. Dr Klein! It’s me, Will Arrowsmith!
(TURNING HEAD) Arrowsmith...?
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 127
Ssh, please! I’ve come to get you out of here!
My destiny beckons. I have no need of rescue.
Maybe not, but I do! The Doctor does, too!
I am the Machine incarnate. I am not required to help the Umbrella Man!
(SWIVELLING) Alert! Alert! An intruder seeks to interfere with the template!
(TO VOLKENRATH) Now look what you’ve done!
You! Move away from the template, so you may be exterm-
FX: DALEK GUNSTICK FIRES, OFF.
STRANGLED SCREAM AS ITS HEAD EXPLODES — NOT MASSIVELY
Qaren! Mind where you’re shooting off that gunstick, you nearly got me!
(GLIDING FORWARD) Qaren. Stop the presses!
(RUSHING FORWARD) Yes, Father. —
FX: BUTTONS ACTIVATED ON PANEL OFF. THE COPYING PROCESS
FREEZES — MID-WHOMP, MID-RELEASE AND MID-:
I am the Machine incar- incar- incar- incarrrrrrrr (WINDS DOWN)
We do not have much time. If the process is paused for longer than fifty rels, the Supreme will be alerted.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 128

(TO VOLKENRATH) Hear that, Dr Klein? Fifty rels, that’s — actually, I’m not sure how long that is, but I doubt it’s much. Davros — that’s him with the face — Davros says he’1l let me live, but only if you’1ll help him.
I have no interest in these internecine squabbles!
(GLIDING FORWARD) Dr Klein. If you are the Machine incarnate, why should you care not to assist me-? The fates have brought us to this moment; perhaps destiny demands you do.
My destiny cannot wait!
Look, the sooner you do as he asks, the sooner you’1l get to your destiny!
I accede to your logic.
(SURPRISED) You do?
But hurry!
Good. Dr Klein, I would have you look into my eye. Deep into the blue of my eye...
Look, before you do your hypnosis whatnot, could I just —
Do not distract me, boy!
All I want is the TARDIS key. The Doctor gave it to Dr Klein, she must still have it.
It is here. But why would you take it, Arrowsmith?
Look, I’m no good in the field. I want somewhere to hide out in while all this destiny stuff is going on. The Doctor wouldn’t mind.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 129
Take it, then, Arrowsmith.
(TAKING IT) Thank you. Right — I’m off back to Monument Plaza.
Wait, Will Arrowsmith. The Doctor’s TARDIS has been transferred to the Holding Zone.
Where’s that? — Oh, don’t worry, I saw a map outside. (AS HE LEAVES) Good luck, everyone, with the whole destiny thing...!
Fool. Now, Dr Klein, repeat after me: I am the Machine incarnate. I serve the will.. of Davros.
The will... of Davros.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 130
65: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM (MONTAGE
FX: THE THROB OF THE AGONY SEAT CONTINUES THROUGH A MONTAGE OF
THE PROGRESSIVELY MORE EXHAUSTED DOCTOR DESCRIBING HIS FUTURE
In the year twenty-three ten, I traced two abducted prodigies from the moon Titan Three to the world of Jaconda, [where a creature named Mestor]
(OVERLAPPING) [.. and so I] travelled to the Sense-Sphere, whose telepathic inhabitants, it transpired, were being poisoned [by the survivors of an Earth expedition]
(OVERLAPPING) [In the twenty-fourth century,] I investigated many hundreds of supposedly routine disappearances on the colony world of Terra Alpha, and [learned that the Colony’s Leader ]
(OVERLAPPING) [With my TARDIS hijacked,] I transported the creature to planet A54 in the system Arcturus, where it attempted to revive Zogron, leader of the —
Stop!
FX: THROB CUTS OFF QUICKLY, ECHOING AS WE CROSS TO:
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 131
66: INT. DALEK CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: DALEK HEARTBEAT.
(WEAK) So soon, Falkus? We’ve barely begun.
Of course not, Doctor. But why linger on your past glories, when my moment of triumph has arrived?
(STEPPING FORWARD) Umbrella Man — it is time.
Dr Klein — you will place your head inside the Machine!
Of course.
(CRANING HEAD) Ah, so that must be the full-size version.
Constructed precisely according to the schematics extracted from the brain of the human Schalk!
Why is it I’m reminded of an iron maiden?
(A HALF-SMILE) Apt.
Elizabeth — please tell me you have some fight left in you.
There is nothing inside me, Umbrella Man. I am empty inside.
(TO DALEK) Seal the headpiece!
FX: HARSH SOUND AS THE MACHINE CLAMPS TIGHTLY AROUND
VOLKENRATH’S HEAD — LIKE SHE’S MASKED, WITH A CORRESPONDING DISTORT ON THE REST OF HER DIALOGUE.
GASPS
(SADLY) Oh, Elizabeth. —
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 132
How does it feel in there, Dr Klein?
(PAINED) It feels like — like destiny!
Then let us begin with a test of the Machine’s true power. —
FX: DOOR OPENS.
(GLIDING IN) Stop!!!
You should not be here, Davros!
Falkus — would you have me miss your apotheosis? Your ultimate victory, over all sentient thought in the universe?
Yes — what loving father would miss school Sports Day, with a son running in the egg and spoon?
Quiet, Doctor! Daleks — watch over Davros, he cannot be trusted.
FX: 2 x DALEKS GLIDE OVER.
DALEKS x 2: We obey!
Dr Klein, let us begin by focusing the field of influence of the Machine to a ten-kilometre area on the surface of Azimuth, directly above.
FX: THE MACHINE CHARGING UP, TAKING OVER.
Yes. Yes, I can do this!

Doctor, Davros — if you would care to observe, on the visual array? It is the morning of the first day a new week for the citizens of Azimuth. There they go, rushing from their underground trains to their offices, busy busy busy, like little worker ants.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (FINAL) Page 133
Such dismal lives they lead!
What would you know about a meaningful life, Davros?
The Doctor and Davros will be silent!
Thank you, Dalek. As Davros suggests, such dismal lives. But I, the Machine, and Dr Klein are about to change all that.
By ‘persuading’ the citizens to bow down and swear allegiance to the Dalek cause?

What good would that do the Dalek cause, Doctor? It is easy enough to acquire slave labour, should we require it. No, Dr Klein — I would have speak to them through the public address systems, and persuade them to stop.
Stop... work?
You misunderstand me. No, I would have their hearts... stop. I would have the electrical impulses in their brains... stop. I would have them all simply... stop.
No!!!

Did you think we would want the Machine for, what, propaganda purposes? No, Doctor. No — we would have whole populations of whole planets, stop. Whole solar systems, stop. Whole galaxies, even... stop.
DALEKS x 3: (DELIGHTED) Stop. Stop. STOP!!!
This is monstrous, even by the Daleks’ depraved standards!
Falkus. I would congratulate you. Truly, this scheme of yours is worthy of my invention!
I.. thank you, Father.
DALEKS AMONG US by Alan Barnes (001) Page 134
But I cannot allow it to continue. Dr Klein — ‘Father knows best’. (BEAT) I said — ‘Father knows best’, Dr Klein!
I heard, Davros.
What — what is going on here? There is something going on here, and I do not like it!
(DESPERATE) Father knows best!
It’s a code phrase, I believe, hypnotically implanted.
Davros — do you dare attempt to hijack my Machine?
Father knows best!
